Posts.Title: Exercising w/ a compression sleeve kap24 SpunkyGirl

Posts.Content: kap24 wrote: I believe the possibility of getting LE, the things one can do to protect against it and treatment once you have it need to be brought front and center. I never thought that after I was diagnosed , went thru surgeries, chemo and radiation that I would ,3 years later still be consumed by this side effect. October brings BC into the national spotlight. I'd like to somehow let the powers to be know that LE is a very real side effect  and that not enough is done to educate women.Frankly, I think most health care professionals don't know enough about it or minimize its impact. I'm looking for suggestions and imput. Thanks, Kathie Dx 12/23/2006, ILC, 4cm, Stage IIA, 1/17 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: kap24 wrote: Hi all, I was wondering how many any of you physically active gals exercise wearing a compression sleeve and how many don't. I've begun a training program called Turbulence Training w/ the hope of jumpstarting my metabolism which seemed to come to a halt after chemo and while on tamox. It consists of bodyweight exercises and interval training. I want this to work and want to protect my arm at the same time. Thanks, Kathie Dx 12/23/2006, ILC, 4cm, Stage IIA, 1/17 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: kap24 wrote: Hi all,  I apologize if this question has been asked before. I was 47 when dx 3 years ago. At the time I was still having regular periods. I have not had a period since after my first round of chemo 3 years ago.  I have now been spotting for 10 days. Am taking tamoxifen for 3 years. Anyone ever experience this? Thanks in advance Dx 12/23/2006, ILC, 4cm, Stage IIA, 1/17 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
